ol.li: Featuring City-Parish updates from across East Baton Rouge Parish

div.class: inner col col24 first last id79f4ac99-be30-49d8-a27e-62eb61f4f32c

h4.a: Suze Orman Joins Mayor Broome for the Financial Literacy Online Workshop Series

div.div: Thursday's final installment of the video seminars will focus on spending habits and budgeting in the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic. Read on...

h4.a: Statement by Mayor-President Sharon Weston Broome

div.div: "Tragic day in Baton Rouge" in the shooting death of one Baton Rouge police officer and the injury of a second. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome Announces Raising Cane’s Purchase of $50,000 in Restaurant Gift Cards

div.div: The transaction was part of the "Keep BR Serving" campaign to support local restaurants affected by the COVID-19 closures. Keep BR Serving has raised over $200,000 for participating restaurants. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome Collaborates with Poet Donney Rose for Stay At Home Message

div.div: Watch Donney Rose perform his spoken-word poem urging the Baton Rouge community to embrace social distancing. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome Announces Distribution of Donated Cloth Masks

div.div: Hanes has donated tens of thousands of masks, which will go to area nursing homes, the school system, the Baton Rouge Health District for hospitals, the Council on Aging, and the Greater Baton Rouge Food Bank. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome Announces Opening of Second MOHSEP Drive-Thru Testing Site

div.div: COVID-19 testing will be available at no charge Monday-Friday at Our Lady of the Lake North, 5439 Airline Hwy., for patients whose doctors have faxed an order. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome Announces Virtual Earth Day 2020 Celebration

div.div: Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, BR Earth Day festival is being held online, and everyone is invited to participate. Residents and students are encouraged to learn and share how they can help the planet. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome Announces February Sales Tax Revenue

div.div: The February 2020 collections were down 3.79% from that time a year ago. The mayor issued an executive order allowing businesses a 30-day extension to file returns due to the COVID-19 crisis, which has also impacted local eateries' income. Read on...

h4.a: Dynamic Construction Group Makes $100,000 Donation During Coronavirus Pandemic

div.div: Half of the sum will go to The Greater Baton Rouge Food Bank; the other $50,000 will benefit Hope Ministries. Mayor Broome encourages community businesses to team up with the city-parish to help local non-profits meet the pandemic's challenges. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome Announces $50,000 Benefiting Minority-Owned Restaurants

div.div: ExxonMobil and Republic Services have committed to purchasing thousands in catering and gift cards from restaurants in North Baton Rouge and Baker through the Keep BR Serving campaign. Read on...

h4.a: Statement by Mayor-President Sharon Weston Broome Concerning City-Parish Finances

div.div: While the health and well-being of our citizens and employees is at the forefront of our efforts at this moment, it is essential that we take steps to manage our financial affairs as well. Read on...

h4.a: Keep BR Serving Campaign Reaches $100K in Gift Card Sales for Local Restaurants

div.div: Mayor-President Sharon Weston Broome and local business leaders, announced Tuesday the campaign has reached $100,000 in gift card sales. The money directly supports locally-owned restaurants and impacted service staff members. Read on...

h4.a: City-Parish Services for Good Friday Holiday and Easter Weekend

div.div: City-Parish offices will be closed on Friday, April 10th in observance of the Good Friday holiday. However, residential garbage and recycling will be collected as normal on the holiday and on Saturday, April 11. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome announces COVID-19 Community Testing Site will be closed for Good Friday

div.div: The drive-through site operates on a Monday-Wednesday-Friday schedule; it will reopen Monday, April 13, for patients whose doctors fax an order ahead of time. So far, 1,807 COVID-19 tests have been administered since the site opened on Monday, March 16. Read on...

h4.a: Registration Open for Financial Webinar Series

div.div: Mayor Broome presents six financial-planning virtual workshops to help citizens manage their money during and after the COVID-19 crisis. The first will air online at 11 a.m. Tuesday, April 14, 2020. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome Addresses Financial Planning Amid COVID-19 Pandemic

div.div: Starting next week, the mayor will present a series of online workshops focusing on dealing with stimulus checks, filing for unemployment benefits, and accessing financial assistance. The series is set to release 6 videos in April. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome announces COVID-19 Community Testing Site will resume Monday

div.div: Mayor-President Sharon Weston Broome announces the MOHSEP Testing Site at Baton Rouge General – Mid City will resume operations on Monday April 6. Read on...

h4.a: Statement by Mayor Broome about COVID-19 Deaths in East Baton Rouge Parish

div.div: East Baton Rouge Parish is about to enter its fourth week since our first confirmed case of COVID-19. As of Sunday, the Louisiana Department of Health has reported the passing of 22 of our residents here in East Baton Rouge Parish. Read on...

h4.a: Statement by Mayor Broome about increase of COVID-19 Cases

div.div: The increase in East Baton Rouge Parish COVID-19 cases can be attributed to a logjam of lab results. Area hospitals have available beds if needed and are constantly working to expand capacity. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome Extends the Closure of City-Parish Buildings, Introduces Community Notification Plan

div.div: All municipal government buildings, including libraries and community centers, are closed to the public until April 30, in line with Gov. John Bel Edwards' Stay At Home Order. Read on...

h4.a: Metropolitan Council to Meet Via Video Conference on April 8

div.div: Public meetings are banned by order of the governor due to the epidemic, but the Metro Council will address certain matters in a livestream virtual meeting. The public can watch it live online, and public comments can be submitted via an online form. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome announces COVID-19 Community Testing Site will resume Friday

div.div: Mayor-President Sharon Weston Broome announces the MOHSEP Testing Site at Baton Rouge General – Mid City will resume operations on Friday, April 3. Read on...

h4.a: CATS temporarily reducing fixed-route daily service April 5th due to COVID-19

div.div: Bus service will continue with less frequency and fewer hours. All rides are free. Read on...

h4.a: Statement by Mayor-President Sharon Weston Broome

div.div: I am very appreciative of our first responders and essential workers during this pandemic. They serve on the front lines of this crisis, ensuring we continue delivering critical services to our community. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome announces COVID-19 Community Testing Site will resume Wednesday

div.div: Mayor-President Sharon Weston Broome announces the MOHSEP Testing Site at Baton Rouge General – Mid City will resume operations on Wednesday, April 1. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome signs Executive Order to Protect more Businesses during COVID-19 Pandemic

div.div: Mayor-President Sharon Weston Broome signed an executive order Monday temporarily suspending the City-Parish’s ordinance governing the suspension or revocation of licenses and permits for bars due to non-payment of local taxes. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome announces COVID-19 Community Testing Site will resume Monday

div.div: Mayor-President Sharon Weston Broome announces the MOHSEP Testing Site at Baton Rouge General – Mid City will resume operations on Monday, March, 30. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor-President Sharon Weston Broome Extends Closure of City-Parish Buildings

div.div: The mayor announced that all municipal government buildings are set to re-open Monday, April 13, 2020, subject to orders by the Governor's Office. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome Addresses Domestic Violence Issues Amid Coronavirus Outbreak

div.div: Resources such as shelter, food, financial help, legal aid, and child-care assistance are available for victims. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome announces COVID-19 Community Testing Site will resume Friday

div.div: Mayor-President Sharon Weston Broome announces the MOHSEP Testing Site at Baton Rouge General – Mid City will resume operations on Friday, March, 27. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome Announces PPE Distribution Site

div.div: Area businesses can donate personal protective equipment (PPE) for use by medical personnel during the COVID-19-related shortages. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome announces COVID-19 Community Testing Site will resume Thursday

div.div: Mayor-President Sharon Weston Broome announces the MOHSEP Testing Site at Baton Rouge General – Mid City will resume operations on Thursday, March, 26. Read on...

h4.a: All Parish Libraries Closed Until Further Notice

div.div: Due dates extended until April 14. Do not return checked-out items to any library branch until they reopen; the drive-through and pick-up services are closed. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome Appeals to White House for COVID-19 Assistance

div.div: Mayor-President Sharon Weston Broome sent a letter Tuesday to President Trump requesting the federal government support East Baton Rouge Parish during the COVID-19 pandemic. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome announces COVID-19 Community Testing Site will resume Wednesday

div.div: 119 tests have been administered at the site Tuesday, March 24. Only patients who have orders faxed prior to 6 p.m. on Tuesday, March 24 will be admitted on Wednesday. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome Announces COVID-19 Community Testing Site Will Resume Tuesday

div.div: Patients whose doctors faxed an order for the test before 6 p.m. Monday may report for testing between 1 a.m. and 3 p.m. today, March 24. Health-care workers administered 140 tests on March 23. Read on...

h4.a: BREC to Close Parish Golf Courses Tuesday

div.div: Courses will reopen as soon as social-distancing measures have been implemented, as early as Wednesday. Amenities such as cart rentals, restrooms, and water coolers will be limited or unavailable. Read on...

h4.a: CATS Continues Modified Schedule with Enhanced Safety Protocol as a Result of COVID-19

div.div: Bus service is still available in East Baton Rouge Parish. Rides are free; customers are required to use the doors at the rear of the bus unless they use wheelchairs and other mobility aids. Read on...

h4.a: Comment on Metro Council Agenda Items Online

div.div: Public meetings are cancelled due to the COVID-19 epidemic, but EBR residents can submit input on Metropolitan Council agendas via an online form. Submissions will be considered public record. Read on...

h4.a: BREC to Close Playgrounds, Dog Parks and Restrooms Through Duration of Stay at Home Order

div.div: BREC will close parish park facilities indefinitely until the governor's order is lifted. But outdoor areas and trails remain open to the public. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome’s Statement on Fatalities Attributed to COVID-19 in East Baton Rouge Parish

div.div: I am deeply saddened to learn of the first fatalities attributed to COVID-19 in East Baton Rouge Parish today. On behalf of our community, I share our love and condolences with the patients’ family and friends. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome Announces COVID-19 Community Testing Site Will Resume Monday

div.div: Baton Rouge General - Mid City's drive-through testing will resume from 1-3 p.m. Monday, March 23, only for patients whose doctors have faxed orders for testing before 6 p.m. Sunday, March 23. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor-President Temporarily Waives Sign Ordinance

div.div: Mayor-President Broome signs Executive Order temporarily waiving sign ordinance as a show of support for small businesses Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome Addresses Rise in COVID-19 Cases

div.div: In the coming days, East Baton Rouge Parish may have a noticeable increase in positive COVID-19 test results. This does not indicate a rapid spread of the virus, but is a direct result of the increase in testing. Read on...

h4.a: Baton Rouge City Court Closure

div.div: Baton Rouge City Court will be closed from Monday, March 23, 2020 through Friday, April 3, 2020. Read on...

h4.a: CATS to enforce social distancing on vehicles during COVID-19

div.div: Baton Rouge, LA - As a result of the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic, the Capital Area Transit System (CATS) is enforcing social distancing on its vehicles effective immediately and until further notice. Read on...

h4.a: Louisiana Businesses Have Access to SBA Disaster Aid

div.div: Gov. John Bel Edwards announced that small businesses in all 64 Louisiana parishes will have access to federal Small Business Administration disaster aid in the wake of the COVID-19 crisis. Read on...

h4.a: Purchasing Division - Public Bid Openings for EBRP temporarily suspended

div.div: Pursuant to Proclamation No. JBE 2020-30 by Louisiana Governor John Bel Edwards, Public Bid Openings have been temporarily Suspended, effective until April 13, 2020, unless terminated sooner. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor-President Sharon Weston Broome Announces Closure of City-Parish Buildings

div.div: All municipal government buildings, including City Hall, will be closed to the public from Monday, March 23, through Monday, April 6, 2020. Read on...

h4.a: CATS to run a modified weekday service during COVID-19

div.div: Until further notice, bus service will end at 9:30 p.m.; customers are required to use the buses' rear doors only; buses are restricted to 10 passengers at a time. Also, bus fares are temporarily waived; rides are free. Read on...

h4.a: Division of Human Development & Services will close due to COVID-19

div.div: In consideration of the COVID-19 pandemic, the Division of Human Development & Services (DHDS) will close to the general public as of 3:00 pm effective March 18, 2020, until it is deemed appropriate to re-open. Read on...

h4.a: Head Start to distribute meals in response to COVID-19

div.div: EBRP Head Start Program will begin distributing breakfast and lunch to Head Start families beginning Monday, March 23rd from 10:00 a.m to 1:00 p.m. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome announces COVID-19 Community Testing Site will resume Thursday for existing patients

div.div: EBR Community Testing Site at BR General - Mid City will resume operations, Thursday for residents who had doctors orders faxed in prior to 6 p.m. on Wednesday, March 18, from 1 p.m. - 3 p.m. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome's Statement to First Responders

div.div: As we face the unprecedented challenges presented by COVID-19, I want to assure our first responders that their safety is my top priority. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor-President Sharon Weston Broome Announces East Baton Rouge Parish’s 2nd Positive Case

div.div: Mayor-President Sharon Weston Broome announced the second COVID-19 positive case, commonly referred to as coronavirus, in East Baton Rouge Parish on Wednesday. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome Announces COVID-19 Community Testing Site will Resume Wednesday for Existing Patients

div.div: EBR residents who had doctors' orders for testing faxed in before 6 p.m. Tuesday are eligible for testing from 1-3 p.m. Wednesday, March 18, at the Community Testing Site at BR General - Mid City. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor-President Sharon Weston Broome’s COVID-19 Economic Initiative

div.div: EBR businesses' deadlines for filing local sales tax returns have been extended in the wake of the coronavirus epidemic. February returns' deadline is April 20, 2020; March taxes are due May 20, 2020. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor-President Announces East Baton Rouge Parish’s First Positive Case of COVID-19

div.div: Mayor-President Sharon Weston Broome announced the first COVID-19 positive case, commonly referred to as coronavirus, in East Baton Rouge Parish Tuesday afternoon. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome’s Statement on COVID-19 Community Testing Site

div.div: The Mayor’s Office of Homeland Security and Emergency Preparedness is working to bring more COVID-19 testing kits to the Community Testing Site. Read on...

h4.a: Statement from Mayor Broome about COVID-19 Tests on Tuesday, March, 17

div.div: Demand for testing at the Mayor’s Officer of Homeland Security Mid City Community Testing Site has now exceeded the supply of testing kits, and they are no longer accepting patients today. Read on...

h4.a: All Locations of the EBRP Library Closed to Public Access (COVID-19)

div.div: In response to updated information regarding the coronavirus (COVID-19), all locations of the EBRP Library are closed to the public starting March 17, 2020. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome Announces Community Testing Center for COVID-19

div.div: UPDATE: Testing Center not accepting patients as of March 17. Residents are urged to call their doctors or 211 if they are experiencing symptoms; providers will send medical referrals for patients to the drive-through community testing center. Read on...

h4.a: Free pick-up meals for schoolchildren at select sites

div.div: State Representative Ted James and Councilwoman Erika L. Green will offer a one-day, meal-to-go option for District 101 and District 5 from noon-1:30 p.m. Monday, March 16. To-go meals will be offered at select schools beginning March 18 through April 9. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome Declares Parish-wide Emergency

div.div: Mayor-President Sharon Weston Broome signs a parish-wide Emergency Disaster Declaration related to the City-Parish’s efforts to protect against COVID-19 Read on...

h4.a: City Court Announces Changes Due To COVID-19

div.div: Normal court operations at Baton Rouge City Court will be suspended until April 20, 2020. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome Activates All Hazards Recovery Task Force

div.div: Due to the continuously evolving nature of the COVID-19, Coronavirus, Mayor-President Sharon Weston Broome is activating the East Baton Rouge Parish All Hazards Recovery Task Force. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor: Permitted Public Events Postponed Until Further Notice

div.div: Effective immediately, I am issuing an executive order to declare a public health emergency in East Baton Rouge Parish. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor’s Youth Workforce Experience Partnership Kickoff

div.div: Local businesses are encouraged to attend Tuesday's seminar to learn how they can participate in a program that will give youth the opportunity to develop job skills this summer. Read on...

h4.a: Grease Trap Data Added to Open Data BR

div.div: This dataset includes location of all permitted grease traps in EBRP, along with inspection details from our Department of Environmental Services. Read on...

h4.a: EBR in Slight Risk of Severe Weather Forecast

div.div: On Wednesday, heavy rainfall is forecast, with potential for hail, tornadoes, and wind gusts up to 60 miles per hour. The parish is under a flash flood watch until 6 a.m. Thursday, March 8. Read on...

h4.a: Open Data BR Now Includes Retail Food Inspection data

div.div: Through a partnership with the Louisiana Department of Health, Retail Food Inspections for East Baton Rouge Parish has been added to Open Data BR. Read on...

h4.a: Mosquito and Rodent Service Requests Added to Open Data BR

div.div: In conjunction with Open Data Day, the City-Parish has added mosquito and rodent service requests, which includes all reported incidents involving mosquitos and rodents that our EBR Mosquito Abatement and Rodent Control office maintains. Read on...

h4.a: Statement by Mayor-President Sharon Weston Broome Concerning Coronavirus

div.div: I am reassured by the leadership of Governor Edwards and the Louisiana Department of Health in preparation of cases of novel (new) coronavirus (COVID-19) appearing in Louisiana. Read on...

h4.a: Baton Rouge to Celebrate Open Data Day 2020

div.div: The March 7 event will showcase the city-parish's Open Data BR portal and tools such as open mapping. It will be held from 2-4 p.m. at the Main Library. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor's Statement on $1.2 Billion in State Flood Mitigation Funding

div.div: The approval of these funds means East Baton Rouge Parish, and many other parishes in our region and state, can continue advancing flood recovery and watershed mitigation efforts. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome declares Crime Stoppers the “Graffiti Hotline”

div.div: Residents who capture footage of vandals on their electronic devices or home surveillance systems are encouraged to share it with law enforcement. Read on...

h4.a: Statement from Mayor-President Sharon Weston Broome

div.div: As Mayor-President, the safety and well-being of every citizen in East Baton Rouge Parish is a top priority. This includes making certain those who are incarcerated are treated humanely. Read on...

h4.a: Baton Rouge to Celebrate Open Data Day 2020

div.div: The March 7 event will showcase the city-parish's Open Data BR portal and tools such as open mapping. It will be held from 2-4 p.m. at the Main Library. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome Invites Residents to Local Police Precincts

div.div: Mayor Broome announces Police District tours beginning Monday, February 10th from 6 p.m. to 8 p.m. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome Announces Results of January 2020 Operation Fresh Start

div.div: The community clean-up event was held during the 2020 MLK Fest. Volunteers and public works crews disposed of thousands of tons of trash, debris, discarded tires, and other litter. Read on...

h4.a: Free Tax Preparation Available

div.div: Residents whose gross income is under $55,000 are eligible for free assistance with completing their income tax forms at select locations. Read on...

h4.a: Graduation Ceremony Held for Trainees in Scaffold-Building Program

div.div: Employ BR and BrandSafway have a program that trains workers to build scaffolds. Those who complete certification are eligible for positions with BrandSafway that pay $14-$17 an hour. Read on...

h4.a: City-Parish Employee Datasets Published to Open Data BR

div.div: City-Parish employee and payroll information is now available on Open Data BR portal. Read on...

h4.a: 2019 Tax Roll Data Now Available on Open Data BR

div.div: The Open Data BR portal was updated to include 2019 property assessment data from the East Baton Rouge Assessor’s Office. Read on...

h4.a: City-Parish Releases 2019 Open Data Policy Report

div.div: The annual Open Data Policy Report outlines last year’s successes in open data and progress toward fulfilling key mandates outlined in the City-Parish open data policy. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome's Statement on the Passing of Lorri Burgess

div.div: Baton Rouge lost a committed public servant today with the passing of former Councilwoman and Mayor Pro Tempore Lorri Burgess. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome's Statement on the Passing of Rev. Betty Claiborne

div.div: Baton Rouge lost a civil rights icon this weekend with the death of Rev. Betty Claiborne. She was arrested in 1963 while attempting to integrate City Park pool. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome Declares Friday LSU Spirit Day, Wagers with Clemson Mayor

div.div: LSU fans are encouraged to share their purple and gold outfits; the mayor will repost the best of fans' selfies. Read on...

h4.a: Red Stick Revelry to Ring in New Decade in Baton Rouge

div.div: Baton Rouge will welcome 2020 with fireworks, laser shows, and by dropping the Red Stick at midnight in North Boulevard Town Square on New Year's Day. The Florida Street Blowhards and Phat Hat will perform on the Crest Stage by City Hall. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor-President Broome Announces Holiday Service Schedule for Curbside Garbage, Recycling

div.div: No curbside refuse will be collected on Wednesday, Christmas Day. Collections will remain active on Christmas Eve and New Year's Day. Read on...

h4.a: Behavioral Health Hospital Coming to North Baton Rouge

div.div: Oceans Behavioral Healthcare will open a senior-oriented practice in Howell Place with the aid of a 10-year grant approved by the Metropolitan Council. It is expected to generate 85 jobs and $2.1 million in tax revenue over a decade. Read on...

h4.a: Real Time Crime Center Gets Major Donation

div.div: General Informatics has given EBR law enforcement agencies use of its 365 RealTime platform, which enables personnel and the public to share incident information in an app. Valued at $495,000, the program is being provided at no charge. Read on...

h4.a: Bond Ratings Demonstrate Strong Financial Standing

div.div: On December 4, the City-Parish sold almost $130 million in bonds to fund MOVEBR transportation projects. Read on...

h4.a: Joint Statement from Mayor-President Sharon Weston Broome and Chief of Police Murphy J. Paul Jr.

div.div: Baton Rouge has experienced a disappointing spike in homicides in November. Mayor-President Sharon Weston Broome and Baton Rouge Police Chief Murphy J. Paul Jr. are communicating about this situation and want the public to know they are taking action. Read on...

h4.a: Thanksgiving Holiday Curbside Garbage and Recycling Collection Schedule

div.div: There will be no trash collection on Thursday, Nov. 28. Read on...

h4.a: Baton Rouge Sees Significant Drop in AIDS Case Rate

div.div: Mayor Broome and some local clinics and emergency rooms instated opt-out HIV testing for all ER patients in 2017. Read on...

h4.a: Baton Rouge Healthy Food Retail Initiative

div.div: Mayor-President Sharon Weston-Broome announced a major milestone in her effort to bring a healthy food retail store to North Baton Rouge. The initiative will address access to nutritional food for the underserved area. Read on...

h4.a: Center for Digital Government Names Baton Rouge Fifth Most Digital City in U.S.

div.div: 2019 innovations include utilizing social media like Nextdoor to respond to disasters; new GIS website and Open Data portal; an interagency platform that uses neighborhood data to fight crime; and savings of about $7.5 million in efficiency enhancements. Read on...

h4.a: East Baton Rouge Parish Disparity Study Results Released

div.div: According to an analysis of City-Parish purchases 2013-2017, 10% of government contract money was awarded to small businesses; only 4% went to local companies owned by women, minorities, or veterans. Read on...

h4.a: South Louisiana Under a Hard Freeze Warning

div.div: The National Weather Service advised that temperatures in our area will drop as low as 23 degrees tonight. Residents are advised to take precautions such as bringing pets inside, insulating pipes, and keeping space heaters clear of combustible materials. Read on...

h4.a: East Baton Rouge Parish All-Hazards Recovery Plan Unveiled

div.div: The plan provides a local disaster recovery framework modeled after FEMA's program. The Metro Council will vote on the plan's adoption at its Wednesday, Nov. 13 meeting. Read on...

h4.a: 2019 Capital Region Veterans Parade

div.div: The 2019 Capital Region Veterans Parade will be held Saturday, November 16, in Downtown Baton Rouge. The Grand Marshals for the parade will be three World War II veterans, all over the age of 100. There will also be a flyover at noon by two F-15Cs. Read on...

h4.a: CATS to Build Rapid Transit Project with $15 Million Federal Grant

div.div: The state's first bus rapid transit (BRT) system's route will span nine miles, connecting Plank Road and the LSU area with frequently-running vehicles and new stations, including a transfer center on Airline near OLOL. Read on...

h4.a: GIS Day Baton Rouge 2019 to be held on Wednesday, Nov. 13th

div.div: Geographic Information Systems (GIS) integrate data and maps for myriad applications. The Main Library will host educational GIS activities for local students during school hours Nov. 13; from 4-6 p.m., adults are invited to hear GIS professionals speak. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome Announces Results of October 2019 Operation Fresh Start

div.div: The weeklong community clean-up effort kicked off with volunteers targeting specific areas on Oct. 19 and continued with public works crews clearing litter and blight along major roadways. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor-President Broome Presents 2020 Operation Budget

div.div: A special annual budget meeting was held at 2:00 p.m. on Tuesday, November 5. The Council will adopt the final budget on December 10. Read on...

h4.a: EBR Fall Household Hazardous Materials Collection Day to be held Nov. 16

div.div: Its location will be the LSU Touchdown Village parking lot at 4000 S. Quad Drive. The semi-annual event accepts residents' household waste that typically isn't suitable for curbside collection. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome Releases Prioritization of MOVEBR Projects

div.div: Airline Highway, Jones Creek Road, College Drive, Florida Boulevard and Pecue Lane are some of the streets scheduled for widening and other improvements. Work is already underway on synchronizing traffic signals and building sidewalks. Read on...

h4.a: Trick-or-Treating Hours for East Baton Rouge are 6-8 p.m. Thursday, Oct. 31

div.div: Halloween safety includes adult supervision, trick-or-treaters wearing highly visible costumes, and drivers being on the lookout for pedestrians on neighborhood roads. Read on...

h4.a: STATEMENT BY THE MAYOR-PRESIDENT

div.div: Recent figures released by the Louisiana Workforce Commission show the Baton Rouge Metropolitan Area has reached its highest seasonally adjusted employment numbers in history. Read on...

h4.a: Entire Graduating Class Offered Positions at BrandSafway Through EmployBR

div.div: Fifteen participants of the scaffold-building program received scholarships through EmployBR to attend River Parish Community College. Starting pay for scaffold builders is $14-$17 an hour. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome's Open Letter to St. George Representatives

div.div: Last Saturday’s election was a defining moment for our city and parish. As Mayor-President of Baton Rouge and of all the residents in East Baton Rouge Parish, it is my responsibility to make decisions that I believe are in the best interest of everyone. Read on...

h4.a: Baton Rouge Veteran’s Parade 2019

div.div: The City of Baton Rouge is hosting the Capital Region Veteran's Parade. It will run down River Road, starting in front of the Pentagon Barracks and ending at the USS Kidd, at noon Saturday, November 16, 2019, in honor of our veterans. Read on...

h4.a: STATEMENT BY THE MAYOR-PRESIDENT

div.div: Mayor-President Sharon Weston Broome offers condolences for the family of Captain Bryan Bozeman, who passed away. Flags at City-Parish buildings will be flown at half-staff until sunset on the day of his burial. Read on...

h4.a: Broome’s Operation Fresh Start Community Cleanup set for October 19

div.div: Volunteers are needed to help beautify parish neighborhoods; participants are encouraged to not only sign up but also "Embrace a Place" by choosing an area to lead clean-up efforts. Read on...

h4.a: Homelessness Outreach Initiative Moves Forward

div.div: The Mayor's Office and BRPD have teamed up with the Louisiana Housing Corporation to reduce the number of parish residents without shelter. Efforts include groups visiting homeless camps and offering access to services. Read on...

h4.a: Small Business Outreach Informational Workshop

div.div: Local professionals and businesses can get information on opportunities in the MOVEBR infrastructure improvement program. The first meeting will focus on right-of-way services on Oct. 3 at Delmont Gardens Library. Read on...

div.div: The city tied with San Diego because of innovations like the new brla.gov website platform, the Open Data BR information portal, and the Red Stick 311 app, which enables residents to request services and monitor their progress. Read on...

h4.a: Essay Contest for Local Middle Schoolers

div.div: Thirty winners will be selected to rock-climb with the mayor at UpTown on Oct. 23 as part of the Move with Mayor Broome initiative. Deadline for submission is Oct. 2. Read on...

h4.a: 2018 International GIS Day Pre-Registration Now Open

div.div: The Nov. 14 event will give students and other participants an overview of geographic information systems technology, which enables users to create interactive maps. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome to Lead Fitness Groups Toward Heart Health

div.div: A monthlong campaign, Move with the Mayor will feature social activities and highlight literal steps people can take to reduce their risk of heart disease. Read on...

h4.a: Voter Registration Drive will be held Sept. 24-28

div.div: The Registrar of Voters Office will visit at least 2 EBR library branches each day of Voter Registration Week to offer residents to opportunity to register to vote. This will help ensure citizens are eligible to cast a ballot in the Nov. 6 election. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome Announces 2018 Community Health Needs Assessment

div.div: Mayor-President Sharon Weston-Broome brings together Five Major Hospitals for the Healthy City Initiative, HealthyBR. Read on...

h4.a: Baton Rouge Announces Tool to Help Eradicate Blight

div.div: Mayor-President Sharon Weston-Broome and Blight Strike Team announced the launch of a Blight Tool and the reviving of East Baton Rouge Redevelopment Authority (RDA). Read on...

h4.a: Street Name Changes dating back to 1857 added to Open Data BR

div.div: Listings include old and new names of streets, the years they were changed, and cross-streets that marked the roads' limits. Read on...

h4.a: City-Parish Completes Phase I of Stormwater Master Plan

div.div: The 3-phase EBR comprehensive plan includes surveying natural and man-made drainage infrastructure, and applications for federal funding. The phases will culminate in a Stormwater Master Plan Report that outlines the next 20 years of system upgrades. Read on...

h4.a: BRFD, MOHSEP Responding to HazMat Incident on Airline Highway

div.div: Baton Rouge Fire Dept. responded to a call today about Tanker Truck venting Acrylamide Solution due to heat. Once Around Mobile Home Park Dr. and its surrounding areas are evacuated. Read on...

h4.a: MOVE with Mayor-President Broome, a New Healthy BR Initiative

div.div: Today, Mayor-President Weston-Broome - announced a new MOVE initiative to promote HealthyBR residents through physical exercise. Read on...

h4.a: Mosquito Abatement and Rodent Control Ribbon Cutting Ceremony

div.div: The new facility is located on Veterans Memorial Boulevard. Read on...

h4.a: Interactive Map Shows Parish's Census Population from 1890-1990

div.div: The new GIS page lets users peruse their neighborhoods' growing numbers — and changing boundaries — over the course of a century. Read on...

h4.a: Baton Rouge Welcomes On-Demand Delivery App Postmates

div.div: App enables delivery of local food and goods in less than an hour. Read on...

h4.a: City-Parish Seeks Firm to Launch Bikeshare in 2019

div.div: Deadline to submit proposals is Aug. 21; contract would require 80 stations with 800 total bikes to be installed and maintained in certain areas of Baton Rouge over two phases. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome Brings ACE Training to Baton Rouge

div.div: The Mayor's Healthy City Initiative is seeking local participants to join a team that trains volunteers to combat the effects of adverse childhood experiences. Read on...

h4.a: Keen Independent Research Selected to Conduct Disparity Study

div.div: Mayor-President Weston-Broome announced that the City-Parish intends to award a contract to Keen Independent Research to conduct its disparity study. Read on...

h4.a: Statement by the Mayor-President on the Death of Councilman Amoroso

div.div: Mayor Broome's statement on the tragic death of Councilman Buddy Amoroso. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome Launches Vendor Self-Service Portal

div.div: New website makes it easier for vendors to register and do business with the City-Parish; existing vendors will receive instructions to create an account. Read on...

h4.a: Join Mayor Broome for Clean Sweep EBR Day on Saturday, June 23

div.div: Officials and community partners will pick up litter at sites around the parish; volunteers are needed to help clean up our neighborhoods. Read on...

h4.a: Red Stick Ready Day Set for Saturday, July 14, at Mall of Louisiana

div.div: Booths at the mall will give out info on how to prepare for hurricanes and other disasters; get tips from emergency responders on building a supply kit and making a plan to communicate with loved ones in the wake of an emergency. Read on...

h4.a: Baton Rouge Named 'Most Water Wise City' in U.S., Led by Students at Southeast Middle School

div.div: The Wyland Foundation hosted the national water-conservation challenge in April. The school was awarded a $500 Amazon gift card for science-class supplies. Read on...

h4.a: Broome Administration Launches Robocall Tool to Deter Illegal Road Signs

div.div: Automated calls are being made daily to phone numbers listed on signs posted illegally in public rights-of-way. Read on...

h4.a: Statement by the Mayor-President on St. George

div.div: Mayor Broome released this response to a presentation by proponents of the City of St. George, a movement to create a separate municipality composed of unincorporated areas of Baton Rouge. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome Announces EMS Mental Health Program

div.div: Support team will help emergency responders cope with workload stress and PTSD from extreme situations. Read on...

h4.a: Law Enforcement Officers Leo Program

div.div: Open-dialogue discussion for youth ages 25 and younger to discuss building better relationships and a mutual understanding with local law enforcement officials. Read on...

h4.a: AT&T Louisiana Donates $40,000 to Mayor’s Summer Youth Employment Program

div.div: Grant will fund training for 50 students to learn coding and web development. Read on...

h4.a: Enhanced crime incident data available on Open Data BR

div.div: The database now displays every reported crime incident’s ZIP Code, Metro Council district, and crime prevention district. Read on...

h4.a: Teen Volunteers, City Workers to Participate in Corridor Beautification Project May 19

div.div: Cristo Rey students will pick up litter along Plank and Evangeline; crews to fix potholes, sidewalks, and clean up trash, illegal signs, and tall grass in area. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome to Host Fifth Annual Family Fit Day on Saturday, May 19

div.div: Community invited to participate in day of healthy, family-friendly activities for all ages at City Park. Read on...

h4.a: MOHSEP Awarded Highest Honor by Emergency Management Accreditation Program

div.div: EBR emergency-preparedness agency receives #1 rating in nation for 11th consecutive year. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome Launches Buy Baton Rouge Program

div.div: New apps sLocal and SellSwipe enable users to find deals on local products from more than 175 participating Baton Rouge businesses. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome Presents Hurricane Awareness Tour 2018

div.div: Get an inside look at a "Hurricane Hunter" aircraft and learn from scientists, first responders, and other experts how you can prepare for hurricane season at the Metropolitan Airport Multiplex on May 9. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor’s Women’s Advancement Commission to Launch Survivor Listening Sessions

div.div: A series of forums will explore the impacts of domestic violence and sexual assault on the Baton Rouge community and recommend solutions. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor's Statement on the River Center Library

div.div: Architecture firm and contractor are responsible for fixing the cause of the incident that shut down the site. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome's Statement on River Center Library Work

div.div: Intersection of North Blvd. and Saint Louis St. will close April 25. St. Louis will temporarily be a 2-way street between Government St. and Louisiana Ave.; it is closed between Louisiana Ave. and North Blvd. Read on...

h4.a: Statement on Inspection Results of River Center Library

div.div: The firm inspecting the downtown construction has released its findings; site construction will resume after repair welds are finished. Read on...

h4.a: Statement by the Mayor-President on the River Center Branch Library

div.div: Mayor-President Broome's statement regarding the closure of streets and businesses around the River Center Branch Library. Read on...

h4.a: Baton Rouge Wins IDC 2018 Smart Cities North America Award

div.div: Mayor-President Broome announced today Baton Rouge is the winner of an IDC Smart Cities North American Award for its Public Safety Common Operational Platform, a digital application utilized by the Baton Rouge Police department. Read on...

h4.a: Saturday's Clean Sweep EBR Day CANCELED

div.div: Parish-wide trash cleanup event has been canceled due to threat of rain and thunderstorms; rescheduled for June 23. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome, Community Partners Utilize Rapid Rehousing Funds for Homelessness Initiative

div.div: Mayor-President Sharon Weston Broome announced today Homelessness to Housing Initiative, a program aimed at securing permanent housing for citizens. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome, STAR Invite the Community to Start By Believing

div.div: Tuesday, April 3rd Sexual Trauma Awareness & Response® (STAR) invite the community to show their support for survivors of domestic and sexual violence. Read on...

h4.a: Statement by the Mayor-President on Alton Sterling investigation

div.div: Mayor-President Broome's statement on the conclusion of Chief Paul's administrative investigation of the Alton Sterling case. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome’s Remarks Regarding AG Decision in Alton Sterling Case

div.div: Mayor-President's statement on Attorney General Jeff Landry's decision not to charge the officers in the Alton Sterling shooting. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome Kicks off Economic Development Listening Tour

div.div: She will visit 36 companies in East Baton Rouge in 2018. Read on...

h4.a: 2017 Tax Roll Data Now Available on Open Data BR

div.div: This Tax Roll dataset contains a full listing of 2017 tax parcels in East Baton Rouge Parish and the cities of Baton Rouge, Baker, Central, and Zachary. Read on...

h4.a: City-Parish Releases RFP for Citywide Disparity Study

div.div: Mayor-President Sharon Weston Broome makes announcements today regarding disparity in city bids process. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Broome's Statement on Fallen Officer

div.div: Mayor-President Sharon Weston Broome is deeply saddened by the tragic death of Christopher Lawton, the Zachary firefighter and policeman who lost his life while bravely serving his community. Read on...

h4.a: City-Parish to Stage HESCO Baskets along Downtown Levee

div.div: Mayor-President Broome announced that as a precautionary measure, East Baton Rouge Parish will deploy HESCO protection baskets this weekend along a small section of the downtown levee near North Street and River Road due to the rising river levels. Read on...

h4.a: Former Baton Rouge Fire Chief Dies

div.div: On the morning of March 6, 2018 former Baton Rouge Fire Chief Robin L. Hurst died at his home in St. Francisville. Chief Hurst had a very distinguished career with the fire service in Louisiana. Read on...
